comments.content:
I agree that it's much more enjoyable to program in Python or something of the like than C, or Visual Basic (sucks!).
About the iPhone, I'm not aware about how much computing power the Android phone has, but there are still computations limits (RAM and processor speed) that are obsolete in modern computers. Can you remember the last time you used a computer with 64 MB of ram? Could you run Java on it? Effectively? I'm sure that the fact the last iPhone (3GS) got an update to 250 MB is gonna change a couple of things. But it won't still run Java, for sure! :-)
